q: Which famous person was cremated at Raj Ghat?
desc: Raj Ghat is the cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi, the Father of the Nation.

q: Lal Bahadur Shastri was cremated at which ghat?
desc: Vijay Ghat is the memorial for Lal Bahadur Shastri, India’s second Prime Minister.

q: Which crematorium is associated with Ch Charan Singh?
desc: Kisan Ghat is the cremation site of Ch Charan Singh, a leader who championed farmers’ rights.

q: Where was Rajiv Gandhi cremated?
desc: Veer Bhumi is the cremation site of Rajiv Gandhi, India’s youngest Prime Minister.

q: Which leaders were cremated at Ekta Sthal?
desc: Ekta Sthal is the cremation ground for both Giani Zail Singh and Chandra Shekhar.

q: Where was KR Narayana cremated?
desc: Uday Bhoomi is the cremation site of KR Narayana, India's first Dalit President.

q: Jawaharlal Nehru was cremated at which place?
desc: Shanti Van is the memorial for Jawaharlal Nehru, India’s first Prime Minister.

q: Which crematorium is associated with Indira Gandhi?
desc: Shakti Sthal is the cremation site of Indira Gandhi, India’s first female Prime Minister.

q: Abhay Ghat is the cremation place of which leader?
desc: Abhay Ghat is dedicated to Morarji Desai, India’s first non-Congress Prime Minister.

q: Jagjivan Ram was cremated at which ghat?
desc: Samata Sthal is the memorial site for Jagjivan Ram, a prominent Dalit leader.

q: Which leader was cremated at Karma Bhumi?
desc: Karma Bhumi is the cremation site of Dr Shankar Dayal Sharma, former President of India.

q: Dr Rajendra Prasad was cremated at which crematorium?
desc: Mahaprayana Ghat is the cremation site of Dr Rajendra Prasad, India’s first President.

q: Which cremation site is associated with both Giani Zail Singh and Chandra Shekhar?
desc: Ekta Sthal is the memorial ground for both Giani Zail Singh and Chandra Shekhar.

q: Which cremation ghat is named 'Kisan Ghat'?
desc: Kisan Ghat commemorates Ch Charan Singh, a Prime Minister and farmer's advocate.

q: Which cremation site is dedicated to Indira Gandhi?
desc: Shakti Sthal memorializes Indira Gandhi for her strength and leadership.

q: Which leader cremated at Veer Bhumi was assassinated in 1991?
desc: Rajiv Gandhi, assassinated in 1991, was cremated at Veer Bhumi.

q: Who among the following was cremated at Abhay Ghat?
desc: Abhay Ghat is the final resting place of Morarji Desai.

q: Which cremation site is not associated with any Prime Minister?
desc: Uday Bhoomi is associated with KR Narayana, who was President, not PM.

q: Which ghat is associated with the first President of India?
desc: Mahaprayana Ghat is the cremation place of Dr Rajendra Prasad.

q: Who was cremated at Samata Sthal?
desc: Samata Sthal commemorates Jagjivan Ram, a champion of social equality.
